(numLdqEntries, CPI).explanation: Increasing the number of load queue entries allows more load instructions to be tracked simultaneously, reducing pipeline stalls and improving instruction throughput, which directly decreases cycles per instruction;

(numLdqEntries, nICacheWays).explanation: The number of load queue entries and instruction cache associativity are independent architectural parameters that operate in different pipeline stages and do not directly influence each other;

(numLdqEntries, enableSFBOpt).explanation: Load queue size and store-to-load forwarding optimization are independent features that can be configured separately without direct causal relationship;
